title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION SERVICES

description.narrative: 1.4 Access to inclusive and equitable child protection services enhanced, which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, Cabo Verdeans, particularly the most vulnerable, have improved access to, and use more quality health and education services, and benefit more from social and child protection and social inclusion, which are gender-sensitive, throughout their life cycle

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 62 Meio de Achada Santo Antonio Praia

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.4 Access to inclusive and equitable child protection services enhanced

description.narrative: A new legal framework on sexual crimes against children, integrated in the 4th revision of the Penal Code and in the 3rd revision of the Code of Penal Procedure was adopted. The programme supported the government in the design and approval of three important strategic documents on VAC, namely the II National Action Plan to Prevent and Fight Sexual Violence 2022-2024, the National Multi-stakeholder C4D Strategy to prevent and fight against child SEA and the Communication Plan“Cabo Verde pela Infância e Adolescência.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
